title: Processes - Average Value of a Function

content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the sine of, open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis, times the cosine of, open parenthesis, 1 plus x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><mo>⁢</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the average value of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>on the closed interval <math alttext="1 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
